title: Projective tensor product
summary: The strongest locally convex topological vector space (TVS) topology on X ⊗ Y , {\displaystyle X\otimes Y,} the tensor product of two locally convex TVSs, making the canonical map ⋅ ⊗ ⋅ : X × Y → X ⊗ Y {\displaystyle \cdot \otimes \cdot :X\times Y\to X\otimes Y} (defined by sending ( x , y ) ∈ X × Y {\displaystyle (x,y)\in X\times Y} to x ⊗ y {\displaystyle x\otimes y} ) continuous is called the projective topology or the π-topology. When X ⊗ Y {\displaystyle X\otimes Y} is endowed with this topology then it is denoted by X ⊗ π Y {\displaystyle X\otimes _{\pi }Y} and called the projective tensor product of X {\displaystyle X} and Y . {\displaystyle Y.}
